description:
But first on Sportsworld this Saturday, I was joined by Paul Canoville the former Chelsea footballer, who was the club's first-ever black player, and Andrew White the former Ireland cricketer, who was part of the 2007 and 2011 World Cup squads. He was in the team that so memorably beat Pakistan in the Caribbean in 2007. We discussed both of their retirements and what they did after they played sport. Paul's personal fight against racism in football. But first I spoke to him about Chelsea's exit from the Champions League, and whether they should have capitalised on Paris St Germain's ten men.

"I think everybody could see that ten men as well. I was shocked myself. It did change the game. I don't know if it was tired legs. But we only needed to score, and which we did, but it seemed that we laid off, and we have been doing that for quite a little while. "
